content: crochet a beautiful feminine tote bag for almost any occasion take it to the beach to shop at your local farmer s market or gift it to the bride for her to carry her things in on her special day this is the revised and updated version of this bag it features sturdy handles and a tighter stitch so that your bag will not stretch out as quickly **this pattern is available for free on my website visit pattern website link above or you can download it here on ravelry as a printable ad-free pdf** **difficulty ** intermediate **materials needed ** 4mm hook or hook needed to obtain gauge bag body 3mm hook handles 360 450 yds #4 lily sugar n cream yarn in ecru or color of your choice for bag and handles 75 yds in jute or color of your choice for handles alone yarn needle scissors 2 yds 4 5mm natural cotton cord for center of bag handles 8 small flower buttons per bag sewing needle and thread optional stiff plastic sheet plastic canvas works as do those clear cutting boards to reinforce bottom of bag **stitches used ** chain= chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet bpsc = back post single_crochet rsc = reverse single_crochet crab stitch **additional terms ** half_double_crochet in the 3rd loop = look at the top of the stitch and locate the sideways v bend the stitch to look at the back* and you should see another v you ll be working into the back loop of that v this is called the 3rd loop 3dc cluster yo insert hook into stitch pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 1st stitch of cluster made yo insert hook into same st pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 2nd st of cluster made yo insert hook into same st pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 3rd st of cluster made yo draw through all loops on hook space/sps = space/spaces st/sts = stitch/stitches prev = previous **gauge ** 16 single_crochet stitches in 4 **measurements ** small 10 1/2 tall by 11 wide excluding handle medium 10 1/2 tall by 13 wide excluding handle **additional notes ** the original tote bag pattern is included at the bottom of the post see pattern for more notes
